channel.title: Cheap Desktop
channel.description: Hey guys, I need a good desktop computer that's cheap and will run great with Linux. It could be a Windows XP computer for all I care, just something that will run great and that's cheap. Thanks!

item.title: Cheap Desktop
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:13, topic:440656”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=543334.msg3987871#msg3987871 date=1336169936]
If you are building it yourself try this processor

Intel® ARK (Product Specs)

Intel® Xeon® Processor E7-8870 (30M Cache, 2.40 GHz, 6.40 GT/s Intel® QPI)...

Intel® Xeon® Processor E7-8870 (30M Cache, 2.40 GHz, 6.40 GT/s Intel® QPI) quick reference guide including specifications, features, pricing, compatibility, design documentation, ordering codes, spec codes and more.


pretty decent if you see the specs.
[/quote]
Little pointless unless he’s running numerous servers. Plus, he said cheap?[/quote]Didn’t see cheap damn…

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap Desktop
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:19, topic:440656"][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=543334.msg3988213#msg3988213 date=1336224843]

Repost on Computer hardware discussion section at MITB, many people there willing to set you up with a rig that would fit your needs specifically, from any store you’d like.

His budget would barely cover the taxes and shipping on one… His best option would probably be the RaspberryPI, unless he could find something very cheap on craigslist

What’s the budget?

Define cheap
[/quote]$50 to free xD

Wow. You can’t even get a used PC that will run windows xp for that price.[/quote]

I found a laptop with no operating system, no battery, and it was used for only $40.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap Desktop
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:440656”]https://www.thinkpenguin.com/gnu-linux/penguin-pro

You can try that out.[/quote]$400 minimum wasn’t what I was talking about when I said cheap, but thanks! I’ll keep this just in case if I would ever need something like this.

[quote=“ziplock, post:2, topic:440656”]Ever thought of building your own? It saves a bunch of money. Although I just ordered a motherboard for my build and it came in DOA, so I guess you have to deal with that.[/quote]Answer to your question, yes, I have thought about it but the type of PC I’m looking for exactly would probably be cheaper to buy the unit than to build yourself. I could probably pick one up free too.

[quote=“Shou, post:3, topic:440656”]Anything runs great with Linux <3[/quote]Rofl, OK.

Read full topic
